alert.note: Alert for Atlantic; Burlington; Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 15 at 3:29PM EDT until April 15 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Atlantic County in southern New Jersey... Southeastern Camden County in southern New Jersey... East central Gloucester County in southern New Jersey... Central Burlington County in southern New Jersey... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 329 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Hammonton, or 16 miles northeast of Vineland, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. * Locations impacted include... Hammonton, Shamong, Chesilhurst, Atco, Victory Lakes, Wharton State Forest, Atsion, Monroe Township, Williamstown, Medford Lakes, Folsom and Collings Lakes. This includes Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 26 and 37. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
